#summary Details about the remote sub-system

= Remote sub-system =

<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/ArduRCT_Remote.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/ArduRCT_Remote.jpg" width="600"><a>

The remote system can manage :
 * Runs in 5v, the analog section can be run in 3.3v through a jumper.
 * Up to 17 RC channels.
 * A GPS (or any serial device running at 5V) at the same time.
 * Channel A0 to A8 can alternatively be used to monitor analog values.
 * Channel A4 and A5 can be used to monitor I2C devices. An adaptater is required if the I2C devices needs to run in 3.3V.
 * Channel D11, D12 and D13 can be used to connect SPI devices.
 * Schmit trigger on the XBee Tx line to ensure proper detection.
 * The XBee Tx, Rx and DIO3 can be remapped to any pin (default to D2 for Tx and D3 for Rx)
